body.p:
to his excellency Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioners John Chumbly Britton Chumbley Martin Chumbley & John Chainey would respectfully represent that they are indicted in the Russell circuit court for the murder of John Pitman they state that they are not guilty of the charge but that Pitman was killed by some of his own party in a fight that they commenced with the petitioners in their own cornfield the deceased came to where petitioners were at work with several men to mob the Petitioners - who are peaceable men and have been union soldiers during the whole war they say that prejudice against union soldiers makes it necessary to ask for executive clemency and request your pardon
We the undersigned recomend the petitioners to the pardon of your excellency.
